message: I just release my first app in the store a few weeks ago. It's fairly simple and I'm not expecting much from it–but I wondered if anyone has some essential tips for promoting non-game apps. Thanks.

check out smartappmarketing.com alot of the examples are games, but the tips work in many cases regardless. there's a couple of lists on there too like this one: http://www.smartappmarketing.com/marketing-topics/3-ways-to-up-your-application-marketing-ante-over-lunch/ also check out linked in for groups. Good luck!

My 2 cents: go for the bloggers, talk to as many you can, that reflect your basic working/life principles. It's much easier to connect with people that are like you than to try to make a "coup" by getting one piece once...
Don't forget the podcasters! There are so many app shows now, getting on some of them can surely help in terms of marketing.

I agree with the above. I co-host and produce The iPhone Podcast (theiphonepodast.com) and I love promoting worthy apps especially from indie developers. I always promote the apps I love and if the app isn't worth recommending I tell them why. I don't usually talk about or write about bad apps, so there is really no downside for the developer.
